description: Think classic eggplant Parmesan, but with a wonderful kick courtesy of Cannabis.
title: Baked Italian Eggplant
ingredients:
3 tbsp Cannabis-infused olive oil

2 cloves minced garlic

1 large green bell pepper, sliced

1 medium yellow onion, roughly chopped

5 Italian sausages (about 1 lb)

1 small carton of sliced mushrooms

1 tbsp Italian seasoning

1 tsp fennel seeds

1 (6 oz) can tomato paste

¼ cup red wine

kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

2 large sprigs of fresh basil

2 1/2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese

1 large eggplant, sliced about 1/2-inch thick

¼ cup shredded Parmesan cheese
directions:
1. Heat the Cannabis-infused olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic, bell pepper, and onion and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.

2. Add the Italian sausages, and cook, turning as needed, until golden, about 8 minutes more. Then add the sliced mushrooms and sauté this mixture until the mushrooms reduce in volume, 5 more minutes. Add the Italian seasoning and fennel and cook 3 minutes more.

3. Add the tomato paste and cook 2 minutes. Add the red wine reduce for 2 minutes, then add 1 1/2 cups water.

4. Stir this mixture on low on the stove top until well-combined, about 5 minutes. Let this mixture simmer on low for 45 minutes. After the 45 minutes are up, remove the Italian sausages, transfer to a serving platter, and keep warm. Season the sauce with salt and pepper.

5. Heat the oven to 375°F. Spread half of the sauce mixture and sprinkle half the mozzarella cheese onto the bottom of a 9-inch-by-13-inch baking dish. Lay the sliced eggplant down evenly allowing for overlapping and season with salt and pepper, to taste.

6. Spoon the remaining sauce and sprinkle the remaining mozzarella cheese over the eggplant slices. Cover the baking dish with tinfoil. Bake for 55 minutes.

7. Remove the tinfoil and sprinkle the shredded Parmesan cheese over the dish. Bake for another 5 minutes, then remove the dish from the oven to serve. Garnish with fresh basil leaves.

title: Baked Lemon Chicken
ingredients:
3 tbsp melted CannaButter

4 chicken breasts

1/3 cup chicken broth

4 tbsp fresh lemon juice

1 tbsp honey

2 tsp minced garlic

1 tsp Italian seasoning

salt and pepper to taste

fresh rosemary and lemon slices for garnish
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F and grease a baking sheet or large casserole dish.

2. Melt CannaButter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook chicken 2-3 minutes on each side just until browned. Transfer chicken to prepared baking sheet.

3. In a small bowl, whisk together chicken broth, lemon juice, honey, garlic, Italian seasoning, salt and pepper.

4. Pour sauce over chicken. Bake 20-30 minutes until chicken is cooked through. Every 5-10 minutes spoon the sauce from the pan over the chicken.

5. Garnish with fresh rosemary and lemon slices, if desired, and serve.

title: Banana Chocolate Chip Muffins
ingredients:
1/4 cup CannaButter

1/4 cup butter melted

1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour

1/2 cup granulated sugar

1 1/2 tsp baking powder

1/4 tsp salt

1 1/4 cup bananas mashed (about 3 small bananas)

1 large egg

 1/4 cup milk

t vanilla extract

1 cup chocolate chips

2 tbsp coarse raw sugar
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Line twelve 1/3-cup muffin cups with paper or foil muffin liners. Or alternately grease and flour 12 muffin tin cups.

2. Mix flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in a small bowl, set aside.

3. In a large bowl, use a potato masher or the back of a large spoon to mash the ripe bananas.

4. Add egg, milk, melted CannaButter and butter to the mashed bananas and mix with a large spoon until all ingredients are well incorporated

5. Stir the dry ingredients into the bowl until combined, do not over mix.

6. Stir in chocolate chips.

7. Divide the mixture between the 12 muffin cups and sprinkle the tops with the coarse raw sugar.

8. Bake for about 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out without cake crumbs. Cool on a wire rack

 (If you plan to freeze, cool completely before wrapping and labeling.)

title: Belgian Waffles
ingredients:
1 1/2 cups CannaMilk

1 tbsp Cannabis-infused maple syrup per waffle (optional)

1 3/4 cup all purpose flour

2 tsp baking powder

1/2 tsp salt

1 tbsp white sugar

3 large eggs

7 tbsp vegetable oil
directions:
1. Preheat your waffle iron before starting to mix the batter.

2. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt and sugar.

3. Make a well in the middle. Break the eggs into the well and beat lightly with a fork. Add the oil and CannaMilk and stir until moistened.

4. Using a spoon, put the batter into your waffle maker and cook until golden and crispy.

5. Add Cannabis-infused maple syrup (optional)

description: A delicious edible recipe perfect for Sunday football.
title: Buffalo Wings
ingredients:
2 tbsp CannaButter

1 cup CannaMilk

1 qt oil (for frying)

1 cup all-purpose flour

2 tsp salt

1/2 tsp pepper

1/2 tsp cayenne pepper

1/4 tsp garlic powder

1/2 tsp paprika

1 large egg

3 chicken breasts (skinless, boneless, & cut into 1/2 inch pieces)

4 tbsp hot sauce(name brand buffalo sauce works well too)
directions:
1. Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 375°F.

2. Combine flour, salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, and paprika in a large bowl. Whisk together the egg and milk in a separate bowl. Dip each piece of chicken in the egg mixture, and then roll in the flour blend. do this twice so that each piece of chicken is double-coated.

3. Refrigerate breaded chicken for 20 minutes.

4. Fry chicken in the hot oil. Cook until the exterior is golden brown, and the juices run clear, this should take around 5 to 6 minutes.

5. Combine hot sauce and butter in a small saucepan. Heat sauce on medium until melted. Pour sauce over the cooked chicken; mix to coat.

title: CannaBanana Bread
ingredients:
1/2 cup CannaButter melted

1.5 cups all-purpose flour

1 cup white sugar

1/2 cup sour cream

1/2 cup chopped walnuts

2 eggs

2 bananas sliced

1 tsp vanilla extract

1 tsp baking soda

1/2 tsp salt
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F. Grease a 9×5 inch loaf pan.

2. In a large bowl, stir together the melted CannaButter and white sugar. Add the eggs one at a time, then add the vanilla, mix well.

3. Combine the flour, baking soda and salt, stir it into the CannaButter mixture until it's smooth. Lastly, fold in the sour cream, walnuts and sliced bananas. Spread evenly into the prepared loaf pan.

4. In the preheated oven, bake it at 350°F for about 60 minutes. You can use a toothpick that's inserted into the center of the loaf, when it comes out clean it's ready.

5. Cool loaf in the pan for about 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to allow it to cool completely.

description: Use this cannabis-infused butter in your favorite baked goods.
title: CannaButter
ingredients:
6 grams Cannabis

16 oz unsalted butter
directions:
1. Heat the oven to 250°F. Grind up Cannabis and spread it out evenly on a baking sheet.

2. Bake the Cannabis for 35 – 40 minutes, taking care not to let the Cannabis go over 250°F and burn (if this happens, you can lose potency).

3. Remove from the oven and cool before grinding into a coarse powder. This baked Cannabis will keep in an airtight container in a cool, dark place for up to 2 months.

4. Heat the butter in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the baked Cannabis and cook, taking care not to let the temperature go over 200°F for about 45 minutes.

5. Remove from heat and let sit, undisturbed, for 10 minutes, before straining through a colander lined with cheesecloth, set over a bowl. Press carefully with a spoon to extract as much butter as possible.

The CannaButter will keep, covered and refrigerated, for up to 8 weeks.

title: CannaCandy
ingredients:
2-3 tsp Cannabis tincture

1 cup sugar

1/2 cup light corn syrup

1/4 cup filtered water

1 tsp orange or lemon flavor
directions:
1. Combine in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat sugar, light corn syrup, and filtered water.

2. Stir until sugar is completely dissolved.

3. Once boiling, insert a candy thermometer. Do not stir after your mixture start to boil.

4. When your thermometer reads 300°F, immediately remove from heat; keep your thermometer in the pot.

5. When the temperature drops to 250°F, stir in orange or lemon flavor, and Cannabis tincture.

6. Carefully pour into lollipop molds or candy molds.

7. Allow to cool completely at room temperature for about 15-20 minutes.

8. Store in an airtight container.

title: CannaCaramels
ingredients:
1/4 cup CannaButter

small amount vegetable oil for greasing pan and parchment

1 cup heavy cream

1/4 cup butter

3/4 cup granulated sugar

3/4 cup dark brown sugar light or dark

1/2 cup corn syrup light or dark

1/2 tsp salt

1 1/2 cups pecans or walnuts toasted, chopped

1 1/2 tsp vanilla extract
directions:
1. Lightly oil a 5 x 9 -in loaf pan, and line the bottom and at least halfway up the sides with parchment paper.

2. Place cream in a large heavy saucepan over medium heat, add CannaButter and regular butter, heat until butters are melted. Gently stir to combine well.

3. Stir in sugar, brown sugar, corn syrup and salt until combined. Place lid on the pot and cook for 1 minute.

4. Remove lid and attach a candy thermometer to the pan. Cook without stirring until the mixture reaches 245°F then immediately remove from heat and quickly stir in nuts and vanilla. Pour mixture into the prepared pan.

5. Let stand until cool (place in fridge to speed up the cooling process).

6. Then use parchment paper to remove caramels from pan. Cut into 4 long rows by 8 short rows to make 32 individual candies.

title: CannaFlour
ingredients:
16 grams Cannabis flowers, stalks, and leaves

utilize parts of the plant that would usually be tossed out to decrease cost
directions:
1. Heat the oven to 250°F. Grind up Cannabis and spread it out evenly on a baking sheet. If you are adding stalks and leaves, try to separate them.

2. Bake the Cannabis for 35 – 40 minutes (stirring every 10 minutes), taking care not to let the Cannabis go over 250°F and burn (if this happens, you can lose potency).

2. Remove the cannabis to cool.

6. Grind your cannabis in a food processor or blender until super fine.

7. Store in an airtight container in a dark, cool place.

title: CannaFudge
ingredients:
1/4 cup CannaButter

3 cups semisweet chocolate chips

14 oz sweetened condensed milk

8 oz marshmallow(optional)
directions:
1. Spray 8″ x 8″ baking pan lightly with cooking oil.

2. Put all ingredients into a microwave safe mixing bowl. Cook on high for 5 minutes, stopping to stir once or twice. Stir well. Pour into prepared pan.

3. Cool. Cut into 24 equal sized pieces.

description: Simple, sugar-free gummies with a tincture twist to give them a little kick.
title: CannaGummies
ingredients:
1/2 cup Cannabis-infused coconut oil

1/2 cup cold water

85 grams packet of flavoured gelatine (one Jell-o pack)

2 tbsp plain unflavoured gelatine (20 grams)

1/2 tsp sunflower / soy lecithin
directions:
1. Turn your stove on low heat. In a pot, add water, the Cannabis-infused coconut oil, and the sunflower/soy lecithin.

2. Continue stirring the mixture until it has a consistent texture and the coconut oil has completely melted. Now, add in the flavored gelatin and the unflavored gelatin while continuing to stir throughout this process.

3. Whisk extensively on low heat for 10-15 minutes until the gelatin is completely dissolved. Make sure it does not come to a boil; make sure that all the ingredients are thoroughly combined. (Do not stop stirring this mixture for the entire 15 minutes)

4. While leaving the pot on low heat, start filling up the gummy bear molds with a dropper (a dropper is a mini turkey baster that comes with most gummy bear molds). Make sure to move quickly. If your liquid starts to separate, it's because the mixture has started to cool. It's critical that you move fast otherwise the oil may separate in the pot. You need to continue whisking throughout the pouring process otherwise the mixture may start to harden and stop binding.n
5. Put the gummy bear molds into the freezer for 20-25 minutes.

description: Redefine the wake n’ bake with some of this milk in your morning cereal.
title: CannaMilk
ingredients:
6 grams Cannabis

2 cups whole milk or heavy cream
directions:
1. Heat the oven to 250°F. Grind up Cannabis and spread it out evenly on a baking sheet.

2. Bake the Cannabis for 35 – 40 minutes, taking care not to let the Cannabis go over 250°F and burn (if this happens, you can lose potency).

3. Remove from the oven and cool before grinding into a coarse powder. This baked Cannabis will keep in an airtight container in a cool, dark place for up to 2 months.

4. Heat the milk in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the baked Cannabis and cook, taking care not to let the temperature go over 200°F for about 45 minutes.

5. Remove from heat and let sit, undisturbed, for 10 minutes, before straining through a colander lined with cheesecloth, set over a bowl. Press carefully with a spoon to extract as much milk as possible.

The CannaMilk will keep, covered and refrigerated, for up to 8 weeks.

description: Mix this simple oil base with your usual oil in a variety of sweet and savory preparations.
title: CannaOil
ingredients:
6 grams Cannabis

2 cups oil (olive, canola, or coconut)
directions:
1. Heat the oven to 250°F. Grind up Cannabis and spread it out evenly on a baking sheet.

2. Bake the Cannabis for 35 – 40 minutes, taking care not to let the Cannabis go over 250°F and burn (if this happens, you can lose potency).

3. Remove from the oven and cool before grinding into a coarse powder. This baked Cannabis will keep in an airtight container in a cool, dark place for up to 2 months.

4. Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the baked Cannabis and cook, taking care not to let the temperature go over 200°F for about 45 minutes.

5. Remove from heat and let sit, undisturbed, for 10 minutes, before straining through a colander lined with cheesecloth, set over a bowl. Press carefully with a spoon to extract as much oil as possible.

The CannaOil will keep, covered and refrigerated, for up to 8 weeks.

description: This infused sugar will give you a different kind of 'sugar high'.
title: CannaSugar
ingredients:
3 grams Cannabis

1/2 cup high-proof alcohol (160+ proof)

1/2 cup granulated sugar
directions:
1. Heat the oven to 250°F. Grind up Cannabis and spread it out evenly on a baking sheet.

2. Bake the Cannabis for 35 – 40 minutes, taking care not to let the Cannabis go over 250°F and burn (if this happens, you can lose potency).

3. Remove from the oven and cool before grinding into a coarse powder. This baked Cannabis will keep in an airtight container in a cool, dark place for up to 2 months.

4. Reduce the oven to 200°F.

5. Transfer the Cannabis to a jar and cover with the alcohol. Screw the lid on tight and shake every 5 minutes for 20 minutes.

6. Strain through a cheesecloth set over a bowl, discarding solids.

7. Mix the alcohol with the CannaSugar and spread into an even layer in a glass 9-by-13-inch baking dish. Bake, stirring occasionally, until the alcohol has evaporated and the CannaSugar is lightly golden.

title: CannaTella
ingredients:
1/4 cup CannaOil

1 cup hazelnuts

12 oz milk chocolate

3 tbsp powdered sugar

1 tbsp cocoa powder

1/2 tsp vanilla extract

pinch of salt
directions:
1. Heat the oven to 350°F and bake the hazelnuts for 12 minutes.

2. Melt the chocolate au bain marie over a pot of boiling water. (Place chocolate in a heatproof bowl and heat on top of a pot/pan of hot water.)

3. Blend the toasted hazelnuts at high speed.

4. Add CannaOil, cocoa powder, powdered sugar, vanilla extract and salt.

5. Blend again.

6. Now add your melted chocolate and blend all together.

7. Sieve CannaTella through a colander lined with cheesecloth, into a bowl.

8. Jar and store

title: Cannabis Coconut Oil
ingredients:
1/4 - 1/2 oz Cannabis

1 cup coconut oil
directions:
1. Heat the oven to 250°F. Grind up Cannabis and spread it out evenly on a baking sheet.

2. Bake the Cannabis for 35 – 40 minutes, taking care not to let the Cannabis go over 250°F and burn (if this happens, you can lose potency).

2. Place the Cannabis in a strong mason jar, add coconut oil and (1 tsp of sunflower lecithin)(optional)

5. Place your closed jar in cold water, then let it come to a boil. (Boil for 2 to 3 hours.)

6. Strain through a cheesecloth.

7. Let it cool.

8. Now it’s time to enjoy the Cannabis Coconut oil.

title: Cannabis Honey
ingredients:
3.5 grams of Cannabis

1 cup of honey
directions:
1. Heat the oven to 250°F. Grind up Cannabis and spread it out evenly on a baking sheet.

2. Bake the Cannabis for 35 – 40 minutes, taking care not to let the Cannabis go over 250°F and burn (if this happens, you can lose potency).

2. Every 10 minutes, gently mix the buds with a light shake of the tray to expose the surface area of the buds equally.

3. Combine the cannabis and honey in a double boiler to apply gentle heat on the stove top.

4. Simmer. Maintain low heat and let the mixture simmer for at least 40 minutes. The mixture should never come to a full boil.

4. Strain the honey. Set a funnel on top of a jar and line it with cheesecloth. Once the honey has cooled off, pour it over the cheesecloth funnel and allow it to strain freely.

5. CannaHoney can be stored in a cool dark area for 1-2 months.

description: When you have a jar of ginger- or garlic-infused cannabis olive oil, the potential culinary applications are truly endless.
title: Cannabis Olive Oil
ingredients:
1/2 - 2 oz. Cannabis of your choice (high THC or high CBD trim)

1 large mason jar

1 large pot of water

4 cups of olive oil
directions:
1. Heat the oven to 250°F. Grind up Cannabis and spread it out evenly on a baking sheet. Bake the Cannabis for 35 – 40 minutes, taking care not to let the Cannabis go over 250°F and burn (if this happens, you can lose potency).

2. While your cannabis is baking, take a large pot of water and start to heat it. Put the mason jar cap on the bottom of the pot so your glass jar can rest on it. 

3. Peel and coarsely chop your garlic or ginger roots and place them in the jar. After baking the Cannabis in the oven, add it to the jar. Pour olive oil into the jar, making sure to cover all of the product.

4. Place jar in the warm water for 1 to 2 hours at a medium low temperature, approximately 150 to 200°. (Use your cooking thermometer to make sure the desired temperature is reached.)

5. After the cannabis and oil have been bound, strain CannaOil using cheesecloth over a strainer.

It's very important to keep these oils refrigerated or frozen after use!

title: Cannabis Strawberry Jam
ingredients:
1 cup CannaSugar

2 lb strawberries hulled

3 cups white sugar

1/4 cup lemon juice
directions:
1.In a wide bowl, crush strawberries in batches until you have 4 cups of mashed berry. In a large saucepan, mix together the strawberries, sugar, CannaSugar, and lemon juice.

2. Process in a water bath. If the jam is going to be eaten right away, don't bother with processing, and just refrigerate.

3. Stir over low heat until the sugar is dissolved. Increase heat to high and bring the mixture to a full rolling boil. Boil, stirring often, until the mixture reaches 220°F. Transfer to hot sterile jars, leaving 1/4 to 1/2 inch headspace, and seal.

4. Stir before serving.

title: Caramel Popcorn
ingredients:
1/2 cup CannaButter

4 qt popped popcorn

1 cup brown sugar

1/2 cup corn syrup light

1/2 tsp salt

1/2 tsp pepper

1 tsp vanilla extract

1/2 tsp baking soda
directions:
1. Preheat your oven to 250°F. Spray a large shallow roasting pan with cooking spray and add popcorn.

2. In a separate bowl mix brown sugar, corn syrup, CannaButter, and salt in a heavy saucepan.

3. Stirring constantly, bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil 5 minutes without stirring. Remove from heat. Stir in baking soda and vanilla; mix well.

4. Pour syrup over warm popcorn, stirring to coat evenly.

5. Bake for 45 minutes, stirring occasionally.

6. Enjoy! Keep refrigerated for extended shelf life.

description: Hearty chicken cacciatore gets turnt up with onions, cremini mushrooms, black and green olives, a dash of wine, and Cannabis.
title: Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients:
½ cup CannaOil

1 jar of your choice of tomato pasta sauce

1-1½ packs of skinned and cleaned chicken breast

1 pack of cremini or button mushrooms

1 medium-sized onion (red or white)

rosemary to taste

salt and pepper, to taste
directions:
1. Take 1-2 Tablespoons of your portioned CannaOil and throw it into a large skillet on low heat. Let this oil heat up for a couple of minutes.

2. Open your pack of chicken breast and throw the pieces onto the hot skillet.

3. Chop up an onion and the pack of mushrooms and place the pieces in the skillet with the chicken. Begin to cook the chicken, mushrooms and onion on medium heat for 10-15 minutes or until golden brown. Add a little salt and pepper to taste. You can cover the pan with a lid to retain moisture.

4. While the chicken and veggies are roasting, in a small-medium pot empty your tomato sauce. Add the rest of your ½ cup of CannaOil into the pot. Drop in a little fine chopped rosemary and salt and pepper to taste.

5. Stir this sauce and allow it to reach a light boil. Once hot and ready, place it off to the side.

6. Once the chicken is done cooking, pour the ganja infused tomato sauce over the chicken in the large skillet and mix with a spatula to get it evenly coated with sauce.

7. Serve immediately

title: Chocolate CannaBananas
ingredients:
one-half sliced banana

1/2 tsp CannaOil or CannaButter (adjust based on your dose)

1 tbsp dark chocolate chips
directions:
1. Combine CannaOil or CannaButter and chocolate chips in an oven safe bowl or a double broiler.

2. Heat at a low temperature until melted. Keep heat low to prevent the destruction of the cannabinoids.

3. Stir canna-chocolate until silky smooth.

4. Add bananas, and coat well.

5. Place canna-bananas on parchment paper, dust with sprinkles if desired, and freeze.

6. Enjoy your deliciously medicated treat.

description: An old-school chocolate chip cookie recipe infused with cannabis.
title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients:
1 cup CannaButter

3 cups all-purpose flour

2 cups chocolate chips

1 cup white sugar

1 cup brown sugar

2 Eggs

2 tsp vanilla extract

2 tsp hot water

1 tsp baking soda

1/2 tsp salt
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F.

2. Cream CannaButter, and sugars together in a bowl; beat in eggs. Stir in the vanilla. Dissolve baking soda in hot water then add to mixture.

3. In a separate bowl, sift flour and salt; stir into butter mixture. Finally add the chocolate chips.

4. Get a baking tray & cover it in parchment paper. Place cookies with large spoonfuls of dough on the tray, evenly spaced apart. There should be about 24.

5. Bake for about 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until edges are nicely browned.

description: Delicious cannabis-infused chocolate-covered pretzels.
title: Chocolate Covered Pretzels
ingredients:
1/4 cup CannaButter

3 tbsp cocoa powder

3 tbsp powder sugar

1 bag pretzels
directions:
1. In a double boiler melt the CannaButter.

2. Once the CannaButter  has melted, sieve in the cocoa powder & powder sugar.

3. Stir on low heat until the ingredients have completely mixed together. Mix thoroughly until there is consistency. Turn the heat off but leave the pot on the stove.

4. Place a pretzel in the Cannabis chocolate mixture and push it below the surface with a fork to coat. Carefully remove, shake off any excess chocolate, and place onto a lined baking sheet.

5. Refrigerate the pretzels until the chocolate is hard, about 1 hour.

description: Protip: slightly undercook your brownies for the ultimate fudgy batch.
title: Chocolate Fudge Brownies
ingredients:
5 tbsp CannaButter

5 tbsp unsalted butter

4 oz bittersweet chocolate

4 oz semi-sweet chocolate

2 large eggs

1 cup granulated sugar

2 tsp vanilla extract

¼ tsp kosher salt

1 cup cake flour, sifted
directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F.

2. Grease a 9-by-13-inch baking pan with butter and line with parchment paper. Grease parchment paper and set pan aside.

3. Pour enough water into a 4-qt saucepan that it reaches a depth of 1-in. Bring to a boil and reduce the heat to maintain a simmer. Combine the butter and chocolate in a medium bowl and set the bowl over the saucepan. Cook, stirring, until melted and smooth, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.

4. Whisk the eggs together in a large bowl. Add the sugar, vanilla, and salt and whisk to combine. Stir in the chocolate mixture and fold in the flour.

5. Spread the batter evenly into the prepared pan and bake until the brownie forms a thin skin on top but the batter is still loose in the center, about 18 to 20 minutes.

6. Transfer the pan to a rack and let cool completely before slicing.

title: Chocolate Sauce
ingredients:
1/4 cup CannaButter

3 oz unsweetened chocolate

1/4 cup butter

1/4 tsp salt

1 2/3 cup granulated sugar

6 oz evaporated milk

 1 tsp vanilla extract
directions:
1. In the top of a double boiler, melt chocolate, CannaButter, and butter together. Stir until smooth and emulsified.

2. Stir in sugar, stirring to combine and incorporate before adding more. (Slowly add more to avoid clumps)

3. Slowly stir in the evaporated milk, a little at a time, until everything is completely mixed. Continue to cook and stir until sugar has completely melted and sauce is smooth, about 3 minutes.

4. Use now for hot Cannabis-infused chocolate sauce or cool completely and package in a lidded container and refrigerate. Microwave for about 10 seconds to reheat before using.

description: Delicious edible dessert recipe.
title: Churros
ingredients:
1/4 cup Cannabis coconut oil

1 cup all-purpose flour

1/2 tsp baking powder

1/2 tsp salt

2 tbsp sugar

1 cup water

1 qt oil for frying

1/2 tsp vanilla extract

3 tbsp ground cinnamon

4 cups sugar
directions:
1. In a large mixing bowl, mix flour, baking powder, salt, two tbsp of sugar and set aside.

2. Add the Cannabis coconut oil along with 1 cup of water to a pan on the stove over medium heat, whisk constantly.

3. Once the water starts to boil, immediately pour it into the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar bowl. Blend this with an electric mixer until it's consistent. Add the vanilla extract and keep blending until the dough becomes smooth. Transfer the churro dough to a piping bag.

4. Pour the qt of oil into a high-sided skillet and place it on the stove over medium-high heat until it reaches 375°F. Squeeze out a 6-inch strip of churro dough directly into the oil and fry for about 2 minutes until the churros are golden brown.

5. Once the churros are cooked, remove them from the oil using tongs onto a plate lined with paper towels.

6. Combine 4 cups of sugar and cinnamon in a large zip lock bag. set aside.

7. Once the churros are cooked, let them cool down. Add the churros to the bag and shake lightly allowing the churros to be completely coated in the cinnamon sugar.

description: Delicious Cannabis-infused recipe, perfect for a medicated dessert
title: Cinnamon Rolls
ingredients:
3/4 cup CannaMilk

2 1/4 tsp active yeast

1/4 cup granulated sugar

1 egg yolk room temperature

3/4 cup CannaButter

3 cups bread flour

3/4 tsp salt

1/3 cup brown sugar

1 1/2 tbsp ground cinnamon

4 oz cream cheese softened

3/4 cup powdered sugar

1/2 tsp vanilla extract
directions:
1. Add warm cannabis milk to the bowl of an electric mixer and sprinkle yeast on top. You’ll know your yeast has activated if it begins to foam after a few minutes. If it hasn’t, then start over; your cannabis milk was either too hot or too cold.

2. Once yeast begins to foam, add in sugar, egg, egg yolk and cannabis butter. Mix until well combined. Next, stir in flour and salt with a wooden spoon until a dough begins to form.

3. Place dough hook on the mixer and knead the dough on medium speed for 8 minutes. The dough should form into a nice ball and be slightly sticky. (If you don’t want to use an electric mixer, you can use your hands to knead the dough for 8-10 minutes on a well-floured surface.)

4. Transfer dough ball to a well-oiled bowl, cover with plastic wrap and a warm towel. Allow dough to rise for 1 hour, or until doubled in size.

5. After the dough has doubled in size, transfer the dough to a well-floured surface and roll out into a 14×9 inch rectangle. Spread softened cannabis butter over dough, leaving a ¼ inch margin at the far side of the dough.

6. In a small bowl, mix together brown sugar and cinnamon. Use your hands to sprinkle mixture over the buttered dough.

7. Tightly roll dough up, starting from the 9 inch side and place seam side down making sure to seal the edges of the dough as best you can.

8. Cut into 1 inch sections with a serrated knife or floss. You should get 9 large pieces.

9. Place cinnamon rolls in a greased 9×9 inch baking pan or round 9 inch cake pan. (I also recommend lining the pan with parchment paper as well, in case any of the filling ends up leaking out.) Cover with plastic wrap and a warm towel and let rise again for 30 minutes.

10. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Remove plastic wrap and towel and bake cinnamon rolls for 20-25 minutes or until just slightly golden brown on the edges. You want to underbake them a little so they stay soft in the middle, that’s why we want them just slightly golden brown. Allow them to cool for 5 minutes before frosting. Makes 9 cinnamon rolls.

11. In the bowl of an electric mixer, combine cream cheese, cannabis butter, powdered sugar and vanilla extract. Beat until smooth and fluffy. Spread over cinnamon rolls and serve immediately.

title: Coffee
ingredients:
0.5 – 1 gram Cannabis

1 tbsp coconut oil

2 cups hot brewed coffee
directions:
1. Preheat your oven to 245°F. Grind the Cannabis, put it into a small oven-safe bowl and add the coconut oil. Cover the bowl with foil and place it in the oven for 20 minutes.

2. Remove the bowl from the oven and strain the oil with cheesecloth to rid it of plant matter. Add the cannabis coconut oil to the coffee and serve with Cannabis-infused coffee creamer to taste.

title: Cookies & Cream Cheesecake
ingredients:
2 tbsp CannaButter

1 tbsp butter

24 of your favorite cookies

divided 3 (250 grams) Philadelphia cream cheese packets

3/4 cup sugar

1 tsp vanilla

3 eggs
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 330°F.

2. Place 16 of the cookies in resealable plastic bag. Flatten bag to remove excess air, then seal bag. Finely, crush cookies by rolling a rolling pin across the bag. Place in bowl. Add butter, mix well. Press firmly onto bottom of 9-inch springform pan.

3. Beat cream cheese, sugar and vanilla in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until well blended. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating just until blended. Chop or crush remaining 8 cookies. Gently stir half of the chopped cookies into cream cheese batter. Pour batter over prepared crust. Sprinkle top of batter with the remaining chopped cookies.

4. Bake 45 minutes or until center is almost set. Let cool. Refrigerate overnight. Cut into 12 pieces, serve and enjoy!

description: These doughnuts require little skill or equipment, but taste as good as store-bought.
title: Doughnut Holes
ingredients:
2 tbsp CannaButter, melted

2 tbsp unsalted butter, melted

3 cups bread flour

1 cup granulated sugar

4 1/2 tsp baking powder

1 tsp kosher salt

1 cup whole milk

1 tsp vanilla extract

1 large egg

canola oil, for frying
directions:
1. In a medium bowl, mix the flour, 1/4 cup|58 grams sugar, the baking powder, and salt. In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, combine the milk, butter, vanilla, and egg. Add in the dry ingredients and mix until a sticky dough forms.

2. Heat 4-inches oil in a 6-qt. saucepan until a deep-fry thermometer reads 350°F|175°C. Working in batches, roll about 1/2 oz.|10 grams batter into a loose, sticky ball; carefully slide into oil and fry, turning often, until puffed and golden, 2 to 3 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer doughnut holes to a baking sheet with a wire rack. Repeat with remaining dough. Let doughnuts cool completely before tossing in remaining sugar to coat.

title: Doughnuts
ingredients:
1 tbsp CannaButter melted

1 tbsp unsalted butter melted

2 cups flour

¾ cup granulated sugar

2 tsp baking powder

½ tsp salt

2 eggs lightly beaten

1 cup whole milk

2 tsp vanilla extract

½ cup granulated sugar

2 tbsp cinnamon

½ cup powdered sugar

½ tsp vanilla extract

½ tbsp milk

pinch salt
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F and lightly grease your doughnuts pans.

2. Whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.

3. In a separate bowl, combine, eggs, milk, CannaButter, butters, and vanilla extract.

4. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry and mix until just combined.

5. Fill doughnuts pan ¾ full (about 3 tablespoons each), and spread the batter into an even layer.

6. Bake for 15-17 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

7. To release doughnuts from the pan, let them cool slightly, turn pan over and beat it gently on the table.


8. For powdered sugar doughnuts, add about ⅓ cup of powdered sugar into a paper lunch bag. Toss doughnuts in the bag one at a time until they are coated evenly with powdered sugar.


9. For the cinnamon sugar doughnuts, melt 2 CannaButter and 2 tbsp of unsalted butter in a small bowl. In a separate bowl, mix together your cinnamon and sugar. Dip both sides of the doughnuts in the butter and then both sides in the cinnamon sugar.


10. For the glazed doughnuts, combine all ingredients and mix until smooth. Set doughnuts on cooling rack and drizzle glaze over with a spoon.

description: A delicious and creamy Cannabis pasta
title: Fettuccine Alfredo Pasta
ingredients:
1 cup CannaButter

24 oz dry fettuccine pasta

15 oz heavy cream

3/4 cup grated romano cheese

1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese

1 dash garlic salt

salt & pepper to taste
directions:
1. With the large pot, bring lightly salted water to a boil. Then add the dry pasta and cook for 8 – 10 minutes or until ready, drain the pot.

2. In the saucepan, melt the CannaButter and cream on low heat. Then add your salt and pepper and garlic salt.

3. Stir in the cheese over medium heat until its nice and melted.

4. Finally, add the pasta to the sauce. Make sure to use all the sauce and ensure the pasta is entirely coated.

description: A traditional, citrus-forward champagne cocktail—that also gets you high. Is there anything better in life?
title: French 75
ingredients:
1 oz Cannabis-infused Ford’s gin

1 oz simple syrup

1 oz lemon juice

4–5 oz Champagne or sparkling wine
directions:
1. Combine first three ingredients in shaker with ice. Shake hard for ten seconds and strain into a champagne flute.

2. Top with a few ounces of Champagne or sparkling wine and garnish with a lemon twist.

title: French Fries
ingredients:
2/3 cup CannaOil (coconut or olive oil will work)

4 large potatoes peeled

3 tbsp salt
directions:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F and line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. Cut your peeled potatoes into strips (into desired French fry shape) and spread them evenly on the baking sheet.

3. Drizzle the CannaOil over them and season with salt. Try to coat each fry relatively evenly with the oil so that there is a consistent potency.

4. Cook the fries until they are golden brown. Around 15-20 minutes.

 5. Allow the fires to cool down, around 5 minutes.

5. Divide the fries into equal proportions and serve.

description: Loaded with garlic, butter, and parmesan cheese, this simple pasta only takes 5 minutes to make.
title: Garlic Parmesan Pasta
ingredients:
2 tbsp CannaButter

2 tbsp unsalted butter

1 lb angel hair pasta

kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

7 garlic cloves, roughly chopped

3/4 cup parmesan cheese
directions:
1. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until light brown, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside.

2. Bring a large pot of generously salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, about 5 minutes. Drain it, reserving 1/2 cup pasta water. Return the pasta to the pot you cooked it in and add the garlic, butter, salt, and pepper.

3. With a large fork and spoon combine the ingredients well, then add a 1/2 cup of the grated Parmesan cheese and the pasta water and continue to combine gently.

4. Transfer the pasta to a large platter and top it with the remaining parmesan.

description: Tender potato gnocchi with CannaButter.
title: Gnocchi in CannaButter
ingredients:
2 tbsp CannaButter

3 large baking potatoes

1 tbsp olive oil

1 large egg, slightly beaten

1 tsp baking powder

3 cups of all-purpose flour (add more if needed)

salt, to taste

grated Parmesan, Asiago, or Romano cheese (optional)
directions:
1. Boil potatoes (skins on) in salted water until done. While hot, remove skins, then put potatoes through a sieve to insure no lumps.

2. Using a large wooden spoon, combine all ingredients until fairly well mixed together. Flour a board, then mix and kneed the potato/flour mixture until it resembles bread dough.

3. Roll out a portion of dough to the width and length of a cigar and cut into 1in bits (you can decide on the size of the gnocchi you want.)

4. Place a fork upside down and roll over the uncut side of a piece of dough you've cut over the fork. Use a little piece of dough to roll at a time and cover the larger remaining portion to keep them from getting dry.

5. Cook one or two pieces for about 4 minutes. Remove and taste them. They should be firm but not too hard.

6. When you have finished cutting all the pieces, place them on a floured board or cookie sheet and sprinkle lightly with flour.

(These can be covered with a dish towel for use the same day or frozen on the cookie sheet, then placed in a plastic bag for future use.)

7. If you are going to use them right away, boil some salted water in a large pot adding a tbsp of olive oil. When they rise to the top of the water, cook for about five minutes. Gently pour into a large sieve or colander.

8. While still in the colander, rinse gnocchi under hot water to remove the flour you topped them with. This will keep them from sticking when you add the melted CannaButter and garlic mixture.

9. Heat a saucepan to medium heat and add a little coconut oil or olive oil with the CannaButter, adding a few pieces of chopped garlic, browning lightly. Slowly pour over the boiled gnocchi. Sprinkle well with grated Parmesan, Asiago, or Romano cheeses.

10. Additionally, you can add your favorite red sauce on the gnocchi after pouring the butter/garlic.

description: These are fancy words for heating up marijuana and alcohol at a low temperature to make an infusion. Nitrous oxide forces THC into the alcohol. Voila: weed vodka.
title: Green Dragon
ingredients:
3.5 grams Cannabis

25 oz vodka

1 L (34 oz) heat-tolerant whipped cream whipper

2 nitrous oxide chargers
directions:
1. Pour 8 – 9 oz vodka into the whipper. Add the cannabis into the whipper. If you use 1/3 of a bottle of vodka, then weigh out 1/3 of an eighth of Cannabis.

2. Attach the nitrous charger to the whipper and then release the gas. Unscrew the charger and attach the second charge and release the gas again. After the second charge, let it sit for a minute or two and then open it up.

3. Next, take out your double boiler. Heat the water in the lower part of the double boiler to around 200 degrees. Pour the infused alcohol into the top of the double boiler.

4. Simmer the alcohol at this temperature in the top of the double boiler for about 45 minutes. It will reduce a bit, so add vodka to match whatever volume is lost in order to maintain the original volume.

5. Next, remove the top pot from the double boiler and set aside. Using a glass-measuring cup, put a small metal strainer on top and then set some cheesecloth into the strainer. Pour the Cannabis liquid into the glass-measuring cup and strain out the leftover cannabis.

6. After straining, add enough of vodka to bring it back to the original volume (250 ml).

7. Now you can use this liquid, Green Dragon, as a substitute for the base spirit in your favorite cocktail.

title: Guacamole
ingredients:
1 tbsp CannaOil

2 avocado’s, peeled and pitted

1 cup chopped tomatoes

1/4 cup chopped onion

1/4 cup chopped cilantro

 2 tbsp lemon juice

1 jalapeno pepper, minced (optional)

salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions:
1. Mash avocados in a bowl until creamy.

2. Mix tomatoes, CannaOil, onion, cilantro, lemon juice, and jalapeno pepper into mashed avocado until well combined, season with salt and black pepper.

3. Serve the Cannabis Guacamole.

title: Hot Chocolate
ingredients:
1/2 cup CannaMilk (More CannaMilk can be used in place of regular milk to increase potency)

2 1/2 cup milk

1/3 cup semisweet chocolate graded

1 tbsp white sugar

1/2 tsp ground cinnamon

6 tbsp whip cream
directions:
1. Heat CannaMilk and milk in saucepan on medium heat for 2 mins.

2. Mix in chocolate, sugar, and cinnamon.

3. Return to heat and cook on medium for 3 to 4 minutes or until foamy (be careful not to let it boil).

4. Whisk until smooth and pour into 3 mugs.

5. Garnish with a sprinkle of cinnamon & 2 tbsp of whip cream if desired.

description: Delicious infused iced coffee recipe perfect for any occasion
title: Iced Coffee
ingredients:
1/2 cup CannaMilk

1/2 cup warm water

2 tsp instant coffee granules

10 ice cubes

1/2 (5 oz) can sweeten condensed milk

1 tbsp chocolate syrup
directions:
1. In a small bowl, stir together the water and instant coffee.

2. In a blender, combine ice cubes, coffee mixture, cannabis milk, sweetened condensed milk, and chocolate syrup. Blend until smooth./n/nPour and enjoy!

description: Stones 12 believers. And non-believers, too.
title: Latkes
ingredients:
5 grams Cannabis buds, ground

4 cups vegetable oil

5 lb Russet potatoes, unpeeled

3 cippollini onions (or 2 regular onions)

2 large eggs, beaten

1/2 cup all-purpose flour

1 tsp kosher salt

1 tsp freshly grated pepper
directions:
1. Using a double boiler, heat the vegetable oil until it simmers. Add the ground cannabis, and simmer for an 60 minutes over low heat, stirring often.

2. Meanwhile, using a box-style grater or the grating disc on a food processor, begin shredding the potatoes. Keep the shredded potatoes from turning grey by immersing them in water. When all the potatoes have been grated and you are ready to use them, drain them thoroughly. Grate the onions and set aside.

3. Preheat oven to 250º F and place a baking sheet inside. When the Cannabis-infused vegetable oil is ready, strain the fiber out (with cheesecloth) and reserve the oil. Drain the potatoes and press them against the colander to squeeze all the water out.

4. Mix the grated potatoes and onions in a large bowl. Add the eggs, plus the salt and pepper. Mix well to combine. Add the flour and mix again. You may need to add a little more flour if the mixture seems too loose.

5. Heat ½ cup of the oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. (Test the oil by dropping a tsp of the latke batter into the pan; if it turns brown within one minute, then the oil is ready.)

6. Make your latkes by frying one heaping tbsp of batter, until golden brown on each side. Drain the latkes on a bed of rice or couscous to help catch the excess Cannabis-infused oil. 

7. Use a spatula to transfer the latkes to the oven to keep warm on the baking sheet. Repeat this process in batches until all the latke batter is used up. Reserve any remaining oil for another purpose.

8. Serve latkes with sour cream and applesauce.

title: Mai Tai
ingredients:
7 grams of dried Cannabis

25oz rum

0.5 oz orange Curaçao

0.20 oz simple syrup

1 Lime

0.20 oz orgeat

fresh pieces of pineapple

1 oz pineapple juice
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 240°F and grind up Cannabis.

2. Spread Cannabis over a lined baking tray and bake at for about 30-45 minutes.

3. After taking your Cannabis out of the oven, let it cool down and put it in a large Mason jar, together with the rum. Shake it well and keep doing this every now and then while leaving it in a dark area for 5-7 days.

(Remember, the longer the mix stays in the jar, the more tasty and potent it will become.)

4. Add pineapple juice, orange Curaçao, orgeat, and simple syrup to your 2 oz glass of Cannabis-infused rum. Fill with chunks of ice and shake or stir vigorously.

5. Serve immediately

title: Mango Breeze
ingredients:
1 – 2 grams Cannabis

ice cubes

vodka (desired amount)

3 cups mango chunks

75 mL cranberry juice

75 mL orange juice

1 lemon
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 240°F. Grind up Cannabis and place into small ovenproof bowl and cover with foil. Cover the bowl with foil and put it in the oven for 35 minutes./n/n2. Once the weed has finished decarboxylating, transfer it to a small container and pour in some vodka until the weed is covered and soaked. Cover the container and store it in the fridge for 24 hours (up to 7 days) to infuse the vodka.

3. Place a saucepan on the stove over medium-low heat and dump the Cannabis-vodka mix in there. Let it simmer for several minutes to evaporate the alcohol, then pour in the water and allow half of it to evaporate. Strain the Cannabis-vodka mix into a blender using cheesecloth and discard the plant matter.

4. Add the mango chunks, cranberry juice, and orange juice to the blender with the crushed ice, then slice the lemon and squeeze out the juice. Blend the ingredients until smooth./n/n5. Serve in a glass with ice and enjoy!

description: Sweet and simple maple syrup recipe to coat your weed waffles, pot pancakes or fried french toast with. Breakfast couldn’t get any better.
title: Maple Syrup
ingredients:
3-6 grams ground Cannabis

2 cups maple syrup of choice
directions:
1. Heat the oven to 250°F. Grind up Cannabis and spread it out evenly on a baking sheet.

2. Bake the Cannabis for 35 – 40 minutes, taking care not to let the Cannabis go over 250°F and burn (if this happens, you can lose potency).

2. Set up a double boiler by placing a heat-resistant bowl over a pot of boiling water and pour the maple syrup into the bowl to heat up until it’s at 160°F.

3. Grab the Cannabis from the oven, transfer it onto a cheesecloth and tie it up into a bundle. Submerge the cheesecloth bundle into the heated syrup for 1-2 hours then remove the syrup from the heat, squeeze out the cheesecloth and allow the CannaSyrup to cool.

title: Margarita
ingredients:
1 oz Cannabis leaf juice

15 mg Cannabis tincture

Cannabis leaf, edible flowers, or greens of choice, to garnish

1 oz tequila

1 oz aquavit

3/4 oz lime juice

3/4 oz agave syrup

1 pinch sea salt
directions:
1. In a shaker filled with ice, combine the tequila, aquavit, lime juice, agave syrup, green juice, salt, and Cannabis tincture.

2. Shake, then fine strain into a lowball glass with one large ice cube.

3. Garnish with a cannabis leaf, edible flowers, or your favorite greens.

title: New York Cheesecake
ingredients:
1 tbsp CannaButter, melted

1 tbsp butter, melted

15 Graham crackers, crushed

4 packages (8oz) of cream cheese

5 cups of white sugar

3/4 cup milk

4 eggs

1 cup sour cream

1 tbsp vanilla extract

1/4 cup all-purpose flour

1 small bar of milk chocolate
directions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F. Grease a 9-inch springform pan.

2. Mix Graham cracker crumbs with your melted butter and CannaButter. Press the mixture to the bottom of the springform pan.

3. In a different bowl, mix cream cheese with sugar until smooth. Blend in the milk, and mix in the eggs one at a time. Add the sour cream, vanilla, and flour, and mix until smooth. Pour the filling into the prepared crust.

4. Bake for about an 60 minutes. Turn the oven off, remove from oven, and let it cool for 5-6 hours to prevent cracking. Place in a refrigerator to chill.

5. Melt the chocolate in a small saucepan over low heat. Add a bit of the cream and stir until smooth.

6. Serve and enjoy!

title: Peach Cobbler
ingredients:
1/2 cup CannaButter, melted

2/3 cup CannaMilk, room temperature

1 cup CannaFlour

1 1/4 cup granulated sugar

1/2 cup brown sugar

1 tsp baking powder

1/4 tsp salt

1 egg

peach filling

8 fresh peaches, chopped

1/4 tsp ground cinnamon (optional)

1/4 tsp nutmeg (optional)
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F.

2. Pour melted CannaButter into baking dish (9x13).

 3. Mix CannaFlour, 1 cup of the granulated sugar, baking powder and salt together. Add CannaMilk and egg. Stir just until all dry ingredients are moistened, do not over stir.

 4. Pour mixture evenly over the melted CannaButter. Let sit, do not stir.

 5. Combine peaches, spices, brown sugar and remaining granulated sugar into saucepan over high heat.

6. Stir constantly while waiting for the peach mixture to boil.

7. Pour the hot peaches into the baking dish evenly over the batter and melted CannaButter. Do not stir.

8. Bake for 45 minutes in preheated oven. Cobbler is ready when batter rises and is golden brown.

title: Peanut Butter
ingredients:
2-3 grams Cannabis

2 tbsp coconut oil

2 cups dry roasted peanuts

1 tbsp honey

1 tsp kosher salt
directions:
1. Heat the oven to 250°F. Grind up Cannabis and put it in an ovenproof bowl with the coconut oil. Cover the bowl with foil and place it in the oven for 35 minutes.

2. Remove the bowl from the oven and using cheesecloth, strain the oil to rid it of the plant matter. Add the Cannabis-infused coconut oil to a food processor along with the nuts, stevia and salt. Process for 4-5 minutes until smooth.

3. Put your Cannabis-infused peanut butter in a sealed container and store it in the fridge, or immediately spread it on a slice of bread and enjoy!

title: Peanut Butter CannaFudge
ingredients:
1/2 cup CannaMilk

2 cups white sugar

1 cup chunky peanut butter

1 tsp vanilla extract

8 oz marshmallow(optional)
directions:
1. Grease an 8×8 baking pan.

2. In a saucepan bring to a boil the sugar and CannaMilk. Let boil for 2 minutes, stirring often.

3. Remove from heat. Add the peanut butter and vanilla and mix until smooth.

4. Pour into a pan and let cool. Slice into 24 equal sized squares.

5. Top fudge with marshmallows (optional)

title: Peanut Butter Cups
ingredients:
1/2 cup CannaButter

6 tbsp cocoa powder

6 tbsp powdered sugar

4 tbsp powdered sugar (sifted)

1/2 cup peanut butter
directions:
1. Prepare a cupcake tin with 6 liners.

2. In a double boiler melt the CannaButter.

3. Once the CannaButter has melted, sieve in the cocoa powder & 6 tbsp of powder sugar.

4. Stir on low heat until the ingredients have completely mixed together. Mix thoroughly until there is consistency. Turn the heat off but leave the pot on the stove.

5. In a separate bowl, stir all of the peanut butter and powdered sugar together until smooth.

6. Spread 1 tbsp of the Cannabis chocolate mixture in the bottom of each cupcake liner. Dollop 2 tsp of the peanut butter mixture on top of the chocolate. Cover each dollop of peanut butter with 1 more tbsp of chocolate and smooth out the top.

7. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until chocolate has hardened. Remove peanut butter cups from the liners & enjoy!

title: Peanut Butter No Bake Bars
ingredients:
3/4 cup CannaButter, melted

2 cups graham cracker crumbs

12 oz peanut butter

2 cups confectioners' sugar

1 bag (12 oz.) semi-sweet chocolate chips
directions:
1. Mix all ingredients, but chocolate chips. Beat until thoroughly mixed and crumbly. Press into a greased 9x13 inch pan.

2. Melt chocolate chips and spread evenly over graham mixture. Let Stand until chocolate hardens. Cut into small squares.

3. To store, place in a sealed container.

description: Ever feel like mac and cheese isn’t super healthy? You’re probably right, but with this simple spinach pesto, you can feel less guilty and pack in some much needed vitamins.
title: Pesto Macaroni and Cheese
ingredients:
2 tbsp CannaButter

3 tbsp unsalted butter

10 oz baby spinach

10 oz asparagus

5 oz cremini mushrooms

1 cup parsley

1 cup basil

1 cup grated Parmesan cheese

1 garlic clove

3 1/2 cups whole milk

1/3 cup all-purpose flour

12 oz grated sharp white cheddar cheese

kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

1 lb elbow macaroni
directions:
1. Heat the oven to broil.

2. Melt half of unsalted butter in medium saucepan over medium heat and grill asparagus till tender. Add cremini mushrooms roughly 3 minutes prior to fully cooked asparagus.

3. In the bowl of a food processor, combine the spinach, parsley, basil, Parmesan, and garlic and purée until chunky. Add 1/2 cup milk and purée until smooth.

4. Melt the butter in another medium saucepan over medium heat; add the flour and cook 2 minutes. Add remaining 3 cups milk and cook, stirring occasionally, until thick, 8 – 10 minutes. Stir in half of the cheddar cheese, salt, and pepper and cook until the cheese has melted.

5. Meanwhile, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, about 5 minutes. Drain pasta, transfer to cheese sauce along with the asparagus, cremini mushrooms, spinach and herb blend and stir well to coat.

6. Spread pasta in a 9-inch by 13-inch baking dish and top with remaining cheese. Transfer baking dish to a baking sheet and broil until macaroni and cheese is golden brown and bubbly, about 5 to 7 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

description: The best movie night snack to munch on next to Cannabis popcorn.
title: Potato Chips
ingredients:
2-5 grams ground Cannabis

2/3 cup coconut oil

3 tbsp salt

3 medium-sized potatoes

1 tbsp pepper

1 tbsp garlic powder
directions:
1. Preheat your oven to 240°F and put your ground Cannabis in an ovenproof bowl. Add the coconut oil to the bowl over the Cannabis and place it in the oven for 30 minutes to decarb.

2. Remove the Cannabis-infused coconut oil from the oven and strain using a sieve lined with cheesecloth to rid it of plant matter. Set the strained Cannabis-infused coconut oil aside; you can use melted CannaButter for this as well.

3. Grab another bowl, fill it with ice cold water and stir in salt. Peel your potatoes, and using a mandoline slicer, slice them into paper-thin pieces. Add the potato slices into the bowl of salty water as you cut and let them soak for 30 minutes.

4. Drain the potatoes, place the slices on paper towels and pat them to dry. Put the potatoes back into the bowl and drizzle the Cannabis-infused coconut oil over them, along with the pepper and garlic powder. Mix with your hands to make sure all the potato slices are covered in the oil and spices.

5. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and arrange the potato slices on it. Bake in the oven at 400°F for 15 minutes, until it’s crisp and golden brown. Remove your Cannabis-infused potato chips from the oven and allow to cool before serving.

description: This ribeye is juicy, flavorful, and easy-to-prepare. And with a garlicky, herby chimichurri sauce, it's downright heavenly.
title: Ribeye with Chimichurri Sauce
ingredients: 2 tbsp CannaButter/n/n(optional: 8 Cannabis fan leaves, finely chopped)/n/n1 qt parsley, chopped/n/n1/2 cup fresh garlic, chopped/n/n1 tsp red chili flakes/n/n2 tsp dried oregano/n/n1 tbsp red wine vinegar/n/n2 cups canola or other neutral oil/n/n2 cups olive oil/n/n2 bone-in ribeye steaks/n/nkosher salt and freshly ground black pepper/n/n/n3/4 cup olive oil
directions:
1. For the chimichurri sauce, mix parsley (and optional diced Cannabis leaves), garlic, red chili flakes, oregano, red wine vinegar, salt, and oils in a large bowl.

2. Rub the steaks with generous amount of salt and pepper. Let rest in fridge uncovered for ten hours or overnight. Take out of fridge two hours before cooking and allow to come to room temp.

3. In a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat, warm the olive oil. Working with one ribeye at a time, cook, flipping once, until well browned and cooked to desired doneness. The timing will depend on the thickness of the steak; a steak 3/4 inch thick will take 8 to 10 minutes for medium-rare, or 135°F on an instant-read thermometer. Transfer ribeye to a cutting board and let rest for 10 minutes. Repeat with remaining steak.

4. Cut steaks against the grain into slices about 1/2 inch thick and transfer to individual plates. Serve topped with CannaButter and accompanied by the chimichurri.

description: Sure, you've tried shellfish before...but have you ever tried shellfish...ON WEED?
title: Shellfish Curry
ingredients:
2 tbsp Cannabis-infused coconut oil

12 oz crab or lobster meat

1 tsp Jamaican curry powder

1 garlic clove, minced

1 tsp granulated onion

pinch cayenne pepper

1/2 cup coconut milk

1/4 cup chicken broth

 salt, to taste
directions:
1. Melt the Cannabis-infused coconut oil in a large skillet over medium heat.

2. Add the crab or lobster and cook slightly, 2 minutes.

3. Stir in the curry powder and garlic, then add the granulated onion, and cayenne.

4. Stir in the coconut milk and chicken broth and reduce slightly, about 3 minutes.

5. Season to taste with salt and serve.

description: The ultimate simple weeknight dinner to help you unwind after a long day of work.
title: Spicy Sardine Spaghetti
ingredients:
3 tbsp Cannabis-infused olive oil

5 garlic cloves, minced

1/2 head fennel, diced, fronds reserved for garnish

1 (4oz) can sardines

1 tsp chili flakes

1/4 cup white wine

1 (15oz) can whole peeled tomatoes, crushed by hand

1 lb spaghetti

kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

8 oz Cannabis-infused or regular ricotta cheese
directions:
1. Heat 3 tbsp Cannabis-infused olive oil in a large skillet over medium-low. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, 2 minutes. Add the fennel and sardines and cook until the fennel is soft, 4 minutes. Add the chili flakes and cook 1 minute more.

2. Add the white wine and cook until reduced slightly, 2 minutes. Add the tomatoes and cook until slightly thick, 3 to 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and keep warm.

3. Bring a large pot of generously salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook, stirring occasionally, until al dente, about 5 minutes.

4. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup pasta water. Toss the pasta in the sauce and season with salt and pepper. Add a bit of cooking liquid if needed to thin it out slightly.

5. Divide among bowls and top each with a dollop of ricotta. Drizzle with Cannabis-infused olive oil to serve and garnish with the fennel fronds.

title: Strawberry Cobbler
ingredients:
40 oz sliced strawberries

2 cups all-purpose flour

1 tsp baking powder

1 tsp salt

1 cup softened CannaButter

1/2 cup light brown sugar

2 tsp vanilla extract
directions:
1. In a large bowl, mix together flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside when evenly combined.

2. In a large bowl, beat together CannaButter, sugar, and vanilla using hand mixer or standing mixer. Mix until smooth.

3. Combine dry ingredients to CannaButter and sugar mixture. Slowly mix until mixture consists of pea sized crumbles.

4. In a 9×13 baking pan, layer mixed berries. Add crumbled dough evenly across fruit.

5. Bake in the oven at 375°F for 30 minutes until golden brown.

title: Strawberry Gin Smash
ingredients:
1 – 3 gram Cannabis

1/2 tsp granulated sugar

1 lime wedge

3 fresh strawberries (2 hulled and sliced and 1 reserved for garnish)

3 oz gin

club soda

fresh mint sprig, for garnish
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 240°F. Grind up Cannabis and place into small ovenproof bowl and cover with foil. Place the bowl in the oven for 30 minutes then remove and transfer the baked cannabis to mason jar.

2. Pour some gin into the jar until the weed is covered and soaked, seal the jar and shake it like a saltshaker for 1 minute.

3. Fill a crock-pot with water until about 1/4 full, set it on low and place the jar in the crock-pot. Allow the gin weed mix to infuse in the crock-pot for 8 hours, opening the jar every hour to release pressure.

4. Next, line a funnel with cheesecloth and place it over a blender. Remove the Cannabis-infused gin jar from the crock-pot and poor contents through the funnel into the blender. Add a cup of ice cold water, strawberries, lemon juice, sugar, and salt to the blener. Blend for a minute until smooth, serve in a glass with a kiwi wedge and enjoy!

title: Strawberry Milkshake
ingredients:
1 1/2 cup CannaMilk

4-7 grams Cannabis

13.6 oz can coconut milk

2 cups milk

12 oz strawberry ice cream

2 frozen bananas

1 cup frozen strawberries

3 tbsp maple syrup

1 tsp vanilla extract
directions:
1. Preheat your oven to 245°F and line a baking sheet with foil. Grind your Cannabis onto the baking sheet and bake it for 20-25 minutes.

2. After the Cannabis is done baking, remove it from the oven and set it aside. Put a saucepan on the stove over medium heat, pour in 2 cups of milk, add in the Cannabis and let it simmer for 40 minutes while whisking occasionally. Be careful not to boil.

3. Strain the CannaMilk into a jar using a colander lined with cheesecloth. Discard the plant matter and store in the fridge to cool.

4. Add the coconut milk, CannaMilk, ice cream, bananas, strawberries, maple syrup and vanilla, and blend for several minutes until smooth.

5. Pour your strawberry canna-milkshake into a mason jar and store in the fridge for several hours until it’s chilled and creamy.

title: Summer Berry Cobbler
ingredients:
16 oz sliced strawberries

12 oz blackberries

6 oz raspberries

6 oz blueberries

2 cups all-purpose flour

1 tsp baking powder

1 tsp salt

1 cup softened CannaButter

1/2 cup light brown sugar

2 tsp vanilla extract
directions:
1. In a large bowl, mix together flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside when evenly combined.

2. In a large bowl, beat together CannaButter, sugar, and vanilla using hand mixer or standing mixer. Mix until smooth.

3. Combine dry ingredients to CannaButter and sugar mixture. Slowly mix until mixture consists of pea sized crumbles.

4. In a 9×13 baking pan, layer mixed berries. Add crumbled dough evenly across fruit.

5. Bake in the oven at 375°F for 30 minutes until golden brown.

title: Toffee No Bake Cookies
ingredients:
2 1/2 tbsp CannaButter

3 cups quick-cooking oats

1 cup peanut butter

1/2 cup bittersweet chocolate chips

1/2 cup semisweet chocolate chips

1/2 cup toffee bits

1/2 tsp kosher salt
directions:
1. Line a baking sheet with wax paper. Combine the oats, peanut butter, bitter and semisweet chocolate chips, toffee bits, CannaButter and salt in a medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until the chocolate chips melt.

2. Scoop heaping tablespoons of batter onto the baking sheet and sprinkle each cookie with extra toffee bits.

3. Freeze for 15 minutes before serving. The cookies can be stored in the refrigerator in an air-tight container for 1 week.

4. Serve the once cookies have cooled
